answers.answer: Did you just stop a medication?  Sounds a lot like ssri withdrawal.  Also sounds like it could be vascular, similar to what happens with migraine headaches.  Only way to start is seeing a doctor, I'm afraid.
Please also get your thyroid checkedGeoff
I havent been on any medication m8, but yer thanks I will go get it checked for sure.
you think it could be something to do with that?I'll mention it anyway, thanks.

Hi,I hope you find a good doctor and get things checked out.  Your symptoms are widely ranged and could be a number of things.  You mentioned on your profile you are interested in Diabetes and Hypertension...do you actually have these things?  Really curious.  Reason I ask, because even though the tingling could be anxiety....it could be something else as well. My dad has had hypertension which has led to heart attacks and also has diabetes...your blood sugar could either be high or low at night and this could make you feel the sensations you are having.  I would personally just go to the doctors and get a full check up and have them run all your blood work.  I suffer from anxiety myself...so have felt some of the symptoms you have mentioned. But the diziness comes from my low blood pressure which I am taking lots of iron for .  Also I take Synthyroid for my thyroid.  get that checked as well...but if they run all your blood tests they will check your thyroid gland..just tell them what you are feeling.Wishing you the best of luck and A HUGE WELCOME TO OUR COMMUNITY!MOIRA

question: Hi guys and girls, I'm Jack and I'm a 21 year old male, I've had different body appearances in my life... I lost a load of weight a few years back and ended up quite thin, now I have put the weight back on and feeling rather crappy about myself. I smoked but stopped since I first had the attack three weeks ago.lately I've been getting dizziness and happens more often at night time (normally happens every week - 2 weeks usually on weekends).. I get these weird sensations run through my body and find it very hard to get to sleep, it mostly happens when I'm lying down I get this electric shock type sensation... my hand tingle and go numb and when I feel my face that feels numb also, these symptoms have also woke me up from sleep and left me feeling worried and panicky sometimes left with a minor headache , also makes me want to go the toilet!has anyone come across these symptoms before?PLEASE LET ME KNOW.Thanks peeps.Jack Ashcroft.
title: What Could This be? Tingling/Numbness.
